---
title: Vendors

description: A vendor represents a product manufacturer.
keywords:
    - vendor
---

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';
import Image from "@site/src/components/Image";

A vendor represents a product manufacturer. You can assign a vendor for each product. 

<!-- Don't forget to mention settings in WE for hiding vendor name from the product page -->

:::caution

You can have up to 1 000 vendors within one store.

:::

To start working with vendors:

<Tabs
  groupId="view-mode"
  defaultValue="desktop"
  values={[
    {label: 'Desktop', value: 'desktop'},
    {label: 'Tablet', value: 'tablet'},
    {label: 'Mobile', value: 'mobile'},
  ]}>
<TabItem value="desktop">

In admin interface, go to **Products** > **Vendors**.

</TabItem>

<TabItem value="tablet">

1. In admin interface, select <Image src="/img/hamburger-menu-button.png" alt="Menu button" width={20} height={20} />
2. In the sidebar, select **Products** > **Vendors**

</TabItem>

<TabItem value="mobile">

1. In admin interface, select <Image src="/img/hamburger-menu-button.png" alt="Menu button" width={20} height={20} />, go to **Products**
2. In the sidebar, select **Products** > **Vendors**

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

The **Vendors** section contains the vendor table. Its appearance depends on the device you use to open the page in admin interface.

In the **Vendors**, you can:
* [Sort vendors](#sort-vendors)
* [Find vendors](#search-vendors)
* [Create vendor](#create-vendor)
* [Edit vendor](#edit-vendor)
* [Delete vendor](#delete-vendor)

<Tabs
  groupId="view-mode"
  defaultValue="desktop"
  values={[
    {label: 'Desktop', value: 'desktop'},
    {label: 'Tablet', value: 'tablet'},
    {label: 'Mobile', value: 'mobile'},
  ]}>
<TabItem value="desktop">

The vendor table contains columns:
1. Name
2. Number of products

</TabItem>

<TabItem value="tablet">

In tablet view, the vendors appear as a table of blocks with the vendor name and number of products.

</TabItem>

<TabItem value="mobile">

In mobile view, the vendors appear as a table of blocks with the vendor name and number of products.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

## Sort vendors {#sort-vendors}

To sort vendors:

<Tabs
  groupId="view-mode"
  defaultValue="desktop"
  values={[
    {label: 'Desktop', value: 'desktop'},
    {label: 'Tablet', value: 'tablet'},
    {label: 'Mobile', value: 'mobile'},
  ]}>
<TabItem value="desktop">

1. In **Vendors**, select <Image src="/img/sort-icon.png" alt="Sort button" width={20} height={20} />
2. Select the sorting you want to apply. Available sortings:
    * number of products (by default, the vendors are sorted from the most products to the less)
    * alphabetical order
 
:::note

If you apply non-default sorting, the sort button has the indication: <Image src="/img/non-default-sort-icon.png" alt="Non-default sort icon" width={20} height={20} />

:::

</TabItem>

<TabItem value="tablet">

1. In **Vendors**, select **Sort**
2. Select the sorting you want to apply. Available sortings:
    * number of products (by default, the vendors are sorted from the most products to the less)
    * alphabetical order

:::note

If you apply non-default sorting, the sort button has the indication: <Image src="/img/tablet-non-default-sort-icon.png" alt="Non-default sort icon" width={350} />

:::

</TabItem>

<TabItem value="mobile">

1. In **Vendors**, select **Sort**
2. Select the sorting you want to apply. Available sortings:
    * number of products (by default, the vendors are sorted from the most products to the less)
    * alphabetical order

:::note

If you apply non-default sorting, the sort button has the indication: <Image src="/img/tablet-non-default-sort-icon.png" alt="Non-default sort icon" width={350} />

:::

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

## Search vendors {#search-vendors}

To find vendors by name, use the search bar above the vendors table.

## Create vendor {#create-vendors}

To create a vendor:

<Tabs
  groupId="view-mode"
  defaultValue="desktop"
  values={[
    {label: 'Desktop', value: 'desktop'},
    {label: 'Tablet', value: 'tablet'},
    {label: 'Mobile', value: 'mobile'},
  ]}>
<TabItem value="desktop">

1. In **Vendors**, select **Create Vendor**
2. Fill in vendor's **Name**

:::caution

A vendor must have a unique name within the store.

:::

3. Select **Save**

</TabItem>

<TabItem value="tablet">

1. In **Vendors**, select <Image src="/img/create-object-icon.png" alt="Create vendor button" width={20} height={20} />
2. Fill in vendor's **Name**

:::caution

A vendor must have a unique name within the store.

:::

3. Select **Save**

</TabItem>

<TabItem value="mobile">

1. In **Vendors**, select <Image src="/img/create-object-icon.png" alt="Create vendor button" width={20} height={20} />
2. Fill in vendor's **Name**

:::caution

A vendor must have a unique name within the store.

:::

3. Select **Save**

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

After you create a vendor, a pop-up window appears. You can choose to return to **Vendors** section or [add products](#add-products) to the created vendor.

## Edit vendor

To edit a vendor and [manage its products](#manage-products):

1. In **Vendors**, select the vendor you want to edit
2. Change the vendor name
3. Select **Save**

## Manage products

You can manage vendor products in **Products** section of **[Edit vendor](#edit-vendor)**.

:::note

All product changes (adding new products or deleting products from the vendor) made in **Products** section are saved automatically. You do not have to save the vendor if you work with its products only.

:::

In **Products** section, you can:
* [Sort products](#sort-products)
* [Find products](#search-products)
* [Add products](#add-products)
* [Delete products](#delete-products)

#### Sort products

:::note

If a product has variants with different prices, only the lowest variant price is used for sorting by price.

:::

To sort the vendor products:

<Tabs
  groupId="view-mode"
  defaultValue="desktop"
  values={[
    {label: 'Desktop', value: 'desktop'},
    {label: 'Tablet', value: 'tablet'},
    {label: 'Mobile', value: 'mobile'},
  ]}>
<TabItem value="desktop">

1. In **Products** section, select <Image src="/img/sort-icon.png" alt="Sort button" width={20} height={20} />
2. Select the sorting you want to apply. Available sortings:
    * creation date (by default, the products are sorted from the newest to the oldest ones)
    * alphabetical order
    * inventory amount (only for products with enabled amount tracking)
    * price 

:::note

If you apply non-default sorting, the sort button has the indication: <Image src="/img/non-default-sort-icon.png" alt="Non-default sort icon" width={20} height={20} />

:::

</TabItem>

<TabItem value="tablet">

1. In **Products** section, select <Image src="/img/sort-icon.png" alt="Sort button" width={20} height={20} />
2. Select the sorting you want to apply. Available sortings:
    * creation date (by default, the products are sorted from the newest to the oldest ones)
    * alphabetical order
    * inventory amount (only for products with enabled amount tracking)
    * price

:::note

If you apply non-default sorting, the sort button has the indication: <Image src="/img/non-default-sort-icon.png" alt="Non-default sort icon" width={20} height={20} />

:::

</TabItem>

<TabItem value="mobile">

1. In **Products** section, select **Sort**
2. Select the sorting you want to apply. Available sortings:
    * creation date (by default, the products are sorted from the newest to the oldest ones)
    * alphabetical order
    * inventory amount (only for products with enabled amount tracking)
    * price

:::note

If you apply non-default sorting, the sort button has the indication: <Image src="/img/tablet-non-default-sort-icon.png" alt="Non-default sort icon" width={350} />
:::

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

### Search products {#search-products}

To find the vendor products, use the search bar in **Products** section.

### Add products {#add-products}

:::caution

You can add up to 1 000 products to a vendor.

If you want to assign a new vendor to a product, the vendor will be changed without any notification.

:::

<Tabs
  groupId="view-mode"
  defaultValue="desktop"
  values={[
    {label: 'Desktop', value: 'desktop'},
    {label: 'Tablet', value: 'tablet'},
    {label: 'Mobile', value: 'mobile'},
  ]}>
<TabItem value="desktop">

1. In **Products** section, select **Add Product**
2. Mark checkboxes for the products you want to add to the vendor

:::tip

Use the search bar to find a product by name.

Mark the highest checkbox to select all products at once.

:::

3. Select **Add**

</TabItem>

<TabItem value="tablet">

1. In **Products** section, select **Add Product**
2. Mark checkboxes for the products you want to add to the vendor

:::tip

Use the search bar to find a product by name.

Mark the highest checkbox to select all products at once.

:::

3. Select **Add**

</TabItem>

<TabItem value="mobile">

1. In **Products** section, select <Image src="/img/create-object-icon.png" alt="Add vendor product button" width={20} height={20} />
2. Mark checkboxes for the products you want to add to the vendor

:::tip

Use the search bar to find a product by name.

:::

3. Select **Add**

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

### Delete products {#delete-products}

<Tabs
  groupId="view-mode"
  defaultValue="desktop"
  values={[
    {label: 'Desktop', value: 'desktop'},
    {label: 'Tablet', value: 'tablet'},
    {label: 'Mobile', value: 'mobile'},
  ]}>
<TabItem value="desktop">

You can delete vendor products in two ways:
1. In **Products** section, select <Image src="/img/delete-icon.png" alt="Delete button" width={20} height={20} /> for the product you want to delete
2. In **Products** section, mark the checkboxes for the products you want to delete and select **Delete** in the bulk operation bar below. In the pop-up window, select **Delete**

</TabItem>

<TabItem value="tablet">

You can delete vendor products in two ways:
1. In **Products** section, select <Image src="/img/delete-icon.png" alt="Delete button" width={20} height={20} /> for the product you want to delete
2. In **Products** section, mark the checkboxes for the products you want to delete and select **Delete** in the bulk operation bar below. In the pop-up window, select **Delete**

</TabItem>

<TabItem value="mobile">

1. To delete vendor products in **Products** section, mark the checkboxes for the products you want to delete and select **Delete** in the bulk operation bar below
2. In the pop-up window, select **Delete**

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

## Delete vendor

To delete a vendor:

<Tabs
  groupId="view-mode"
  defaultValue="desktop"
  values={[
    {label: 'Desktop', value: 'desktop'},
    {label: 'Tablet', value: 'tablet'},
    {label: 'Mobile', value: 'mobile'},
  ]}>
<TabItem value="desktop">

I. First option:
   1. In **Vendors**, select <Image src="/img/delete-icon.png" alt="Delete button" width={20} height={20} /> for vendor you want to  delete
   2. In the pop-up window, select **Delete**

II. Second option:  
   1. In **Vendors**, select the vendor name you want to delete
   2. In **Edit vendor**,  select **Delete** below
   3. In the pop-up window, select **Delete**

</TabItem>

<TabItem value="tablet">

1. In **Vendors**, select the vendor you want to delete
2. In **Edit vendor**, select **Delete** below
3. In the pop-up window, select **Delete**

</TabItem>

<TabItem value="mobile">

1. In **Vendors**, select the vendor you want to delete
2. In **Edit vendor**, select **Delete** below
3. In the pop-up window, select **Delete**

</TabItem>
</Tabs>
